image.altText: A man in a suit stands with his arms out behind a lectern, with two other men in suits standing either side of him

props.synopsis: The meeting of world leaders at The Hague resulted in a spending increase for most European members of NATO, but it was the US president that once again set the tone.

title.children: NATO chief calls Trump 'daddy' at summit that saw Europe's defence spending increase

image.altText: A satellite image of a nuclear facility embedded in mountains.

props.synopsis: Speaking at a NATO press conference in the Netherlands, the US president said Washington and Tehran could strike a deal.

title.children: Trump says US and Iran to hold nuclear talks next week

image.altText: Netanyahu in a suit at a podium with his hand raised

props.synopsis: The blow to Iran's nuclear program from US and Israeli strikes remains unclear as Israel announces Tehran has been set "years back".

title.children: Israel claims Iran's nuclear program set back 'years'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: CIA chief: 'Body' of intel suggests Iranian nuclear program 'severely damaged'

image.altText: women wearing religious clothing and waving Iranian flags.

props.synopsis: Despite a ceasefire being declared between Israel, the United States and Iran, we're now "moving into a true danger zone", some analysts say, because the Islamic Republic is now trying to develop a nuclear weapon faster than ever.

title.children: Despite Israel-Iran ceasefire, some analysts say we're moving into a 'danger zone'

image.altText: Mitch Starc raises his arms

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc has picked up two early wickets after West Indies pacers Shamar Joseph and Jayden Seales conspired to bowl Australia out for 180 on day one of the opening test in Bridgetown. Follow live.

title.children: Starc makes a double breakthrough after Australia bowled out for 180 by West Indies

image.altText: An adult white woman with long blonde hair and a black coat standing in front of a power point presentation

props.synopsis: New resources launched by Australia's Education Research Organisation will arm all teachers with the skills to teach writing.

title.children: 'Wasn't part of the syllabus': Australia's 30-year fail in teaching writing

image.altText: A builder shovels gravel next to a digger.

props.synopsis: There are calls for the age pension to kick in sooner for manual labourers who are physically struggling to work until retirement age.

title.children: Call for manual labourers to access pension earlier due to 'worn out' bodies

image.altText: Two men in suits hold a framed wooden fish in front of a wood-panelled wall

props.synopsis: Australia will provide sweeping support for Solomon Islands ahead of a key leaders meeting in September.

title.children: Australia to unveil $20m package for Solomon Islands ahead of key forum

image.altText: Silver gas pipelines run along ground with trees behidn them

props.synopsis: Australian households are using less gas, with some getting off the fuel entirely. And that changes the whole business model for gas pipelines in a way that could see consumers paying more.

title.children: As gas use declines, those remaining could foot bigger bills

image.altText: A sign on a brick wall reads 'Western Sydney University', in the distance are some large buildings.

props.synopsis: The Australian Sanctions Office has investigated an event held on the campus of Western Sydney University as possibly breaching sanctions placed on PressTV, Iran's state media outlet.

title.children: Uni cops sanctions warning after Iran state media attended event on campus

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf 4 analysis

props.synopsis: In a "state of panic" the ABC bowed to pressure from pro-Israel lobbyists and fired radio presenter Antoinette Lattouf to avoid complaints and attention. Ironically the broadcaster earned more scrutiny in court.

title.children: The ABC's own goal on Antoinette Lattouf should be a moment of reflection

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

props.synopsis: Medical students say a rural work program meant to solve doctor shortages is pushing some to abandon their careers and others to pay their way out.

title.children: A $170 million scheme sending doctors to work in regions is falling short

image.altText: a child shovels sand into a plastic bucket

props.synopsis: The state government has committed to implement a number of reforms, including a new independent regulator, following a review into the early childhood sector by the former deputy NSW Ombudsman.

title.children: NSW to introduce independent early childhood regulator following review into sector

image.altText: Donald Trump shakes the hand of Volodymyr Zelenskyy as they sit beside each other in a room.

props.synopsis: Australia's Defence Minister Richard Marles was among those to attend a NATO summit and announced Australia would sanction 37 Russian individuals.

title.children: Trump meets Zelenskyy, says US may supply Ukraine with more missiles

image.altText: A close-up of a woman's face looking into the camera with a neutral expression. She has long grey hair and blue eyes.

props.synopsis: A major hospital's infectious diseases unit will be moved across a main road, after the doctors' union lost an appeal to stop the relocation.

title.children: Concerns raised for HIV care after tribunal dismisses bid to halt infection unit move

image.altText: Aerial view of cleared land

props.synopsis: A Victorian sawmill has harvested wood from endangered mountain ash forests and sold it to Domino's as woodchips to smoke meat for pizzas.

title.children: Domino's pizzas allegedly cooked using woodchips from endangered possum habitat

image.altText: An aerial photo shows a series of five dams surrounded by grass and trees.

props.synopsis: Despite a moratorium on building new dams in the Mount Lofty Ranges since 2013, landholders have built about 400 and enlarged about 300 without approval.

title.children: Satellite photos reveal hundreds of illegal dams in SA region

image.altText: Australian currency is seen next to a wages graph

props.synopsis: Consumer prices rose 2.1 per cent over the year to May, down from 2.4 per cent the previous month, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: Inflation eases back more than expected in May

image.altText: A man from UNICEF in a bulletproof vest sits with a 13-year-old boy from Gaza with bandages across his torso.

props.synopsis: As a child dies from shrapnel wounds to his stomach and Israel denies starvation is occurring in Gaza the UN's aid urgency issues a warning that kids may soon die of thirst.

title.children: Thirteen-year-old Abed died weeks after shrapnel ripped through him in Gaza

image.altText: Two Aboriginal women sit below a tree wearing shirts with the faces Cindy and Mona

props.synopsis: After decades of advocacy from her family, 'Cindy's Law' closes a loophole that allowed a young woman's perpetrator to walk free.

title.children: Their daughters died and a man walked free. Today they saw some justice

image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: Mandatory pre-commitment cards for poker machine players, aimed to limit the harm for problem gamblers, won't be introduced in Tasmania unless other states and territories agree to a national approach on the issue, the Premier Rockliff says.

title.children: Pokies pre-commitment card won't go ahead without 'national approach'

image.altText: An underwater photo of three seahorses, one is yellow, one is black and one is cream coloured.

props.synopsis: White's Seahorse is found in seagrass beds along Australia's east coast, but little is known of their numbers in Queensland.

title.children: Population survey of 'charismatic little fish' underway in Queensland

image.altText: A shed and cars submerged in floodwaters, trees in the background.

props.synopsis: Many across south-east Queensland are still assessing the damage wrought by ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred earlier this year.

title.children: Clean-up continues three months after Alfred

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Justice Christopher Beale's directions to the jury in Ms Patterson's triple-murder trial enter their second day at the Latrobe Valley Law Courts in the regional Victorian town of Morwell.

title.children: Judge in Erin Patterson trial continues final instructions to jury

image.altText: A man, smiling, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: A jury finds a man who stabbed a young Melbourne doctor 11 times after a home invasion guilty of murder.

title.children: Jury finds man guilty of murdering doctor Ashley Gordon

image.altText: A loaded container ship sails off from a container terminal across calm blue waters.

props.synopsis: Australia has an opportunity to become the world's dominant provider of green shipping fuel, says Superpower Institute chair Rod Sims.

title.children: Australia should dominate supply of green shipping fuel, says Rod Sims

image.altText: Ley walks through crowd, Anne Ruston walks behind her.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley opens a major address with an acknowledgement of country and speaks of her "respect" for public servants, marking a subtle shift in tone from a Coalition election campaign that saw the Liberals nearly wiped out of Australia's major cities.

title.children: Sussan Ley's press club address marks tone shift for Liberals

image.altText: Man smiling in front of Port Adelaide Football Club logo.

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide Football Club will conduct a formal governance review after it says concerns were raised regarding club director Warren Tredrea's online content.

title.children: Port launches review following concerns over Tredrea's online content

image.altText: A woman in yellow jumper holding shopping bag faces a supermarket shelf full of colourful wrapped foods.

props.synopsis: Aldi has the best price for a basket of 14 regularly priced items, followed by Woolworths, Coles and IGA.

title.children: Where to buy the cheapest groceries, according to latest Choice survey

image.altText: A husband and wife smile for a photo.

props.synopsis: Some Canberrans are "gobsmacked" by the ACT government's new health levy, particularly those left languishing on lengthy surgery waiting lists.

title.children: Iftekhar's waited 922 days for surgery. He's 'gobsmacked' by a new health levy

image.altText: A view of farmland taken from a rocky outcrop in western Victoria.

props.synopsis: Western Victoria will host one of the world's largest rare earth mines after Astron Corporation's Donald Project receives final approval by the Victorian government, as farmers in the area express dismay.

title.children: Donald Project gets green light from Victorian government

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: A woman found not guilty by mental incompetence of stabbing her children has requested she be allowed supervised trips outside of a mental health facility.

title.children: Mother who stabbed two sons seeks release from mental health facility as fathers recall trauma

image.altText: A man in a suit with a red tie smiling and waving.

props.synopsis: Former New York governor Andrew Cuomo on Tuesday conceded to Zohran Mamdani in the Democratic primary election for New York City mayor, setting up the 33-year-old to win the party's nomination in the heavily Democratic city.

title.children: Andrew Cuomo concedes New York City Democratic mayoral contest

image.altText: Composite image of Gout Gout and Usain Bolt running.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout's star is rising even faster than his legs can carry him, and with a world championships debut on the horizon, managing expectations is going to be difficult.

title.children: If Gout struggles at the world championships, he's only as bad as Bolt
